title: Cripple Creek, Colorado
summary: The historic City of Cripple Creek is the Statutory City that is the county seat of Teller County, Colorado, United States.[1] The city population was 1,155 at the 2020 United States Census.[6] Cripple Creek is a former gold mining camp located 20 miles (32Â km) southwest of Colorado Springs near the base of Pikes Peak. The Cripple Creek Historic District, which received National Historic Landmark status in 1961, includes part or all of the city and the surrounding area.  The city is now a part of the Colorado Springs, CO Metropolitan Statistical Area and the Front Range Urban Corridor.
